title: Get stuck replacing a dir with a file

labels.name: bug
labels.description: A problem with current functionality, as opposed to missing functionality (enhancement)

labels.name: frozen-due-to-age
labels.description: Issues closed and untouched for a long time, together with being locked for discussion

body:
This is from the the TestSyncClusterStaggeredVersioning test. `2/2b/2b4b294f0a1aae991ba5253a36ca507c/1` is a dir that becomes a file. We do the transition by moving it away to the versions dir and then creating the file in it's place. However a little later on we try to delete the files that were inside the dir (since deletes are handled last...) and get back "not a directory" when trying to slash past what is now a file...

```
[JMFJC] 21:24:53 VERBOSE: Started syncing "default" / "2/2b/2b4b294f0a1aae991ba5253a36ca507c/1" (update dir)
[JMFJC] 21:24:53 VERBOSE: Finished syncing "default" / "2/2b/2b4b294f0a1aae991ba5253a36ca507c/1" (update dir): Success
[JMFJC] 21:24:53 VERBOSE: Started syncing "default" / "2/2b/2b4b294f0a1aae991ba5253a36ca507c/1/12" (update dir)
[JMFJC] 21:24:53 VERBOSE: Finished syncing "default" / "2/2b/2b4b294f0a1aae991ba5253a36ca507c/1/12" (update dir): Success

[JMFJC] 21:24:53 VERBOSE: Finished syncing "default" / "2/2b/2b4b294f0a1aae991ba5253a36ca507c/1/1a" (update dir): Success

[JMFJC] 21:24:57 VERBOSE: Finished syncing "default" / "2/2b/2b4b294f0a1aae991ba5253a36ca507c/1/1a/1aaf4d75e552e478b482404bdfa9ad98" (update file): Success
[JMFJC] 21:24:57 VERBOSE: Started syncing "default" / "2/2b/2b4b294f0a1aae991ba5253a36ca507c/1/12/124b5b8214374c01a3d217dd05960957" (update file)
[JMFJC] 21:24:57 VERBOSE: Finished syncing "default" / "2/2b/2b4b294f0a1aae991ba5253a36ca507c/1/12/124b5b8214374c01a3d217dd05960957" (update file): Success
[JMFJC] 21:25:24 VERBOSE: Started syncing "default" / "2/2b/2b4b294f0a1aae991ba5253a36ca507c/1" (update file)
[JMFJC] 21:25:25 INFO: non-file "/go/src/github.com/syncthing/syncthing/test/s2/.stversions/2/2b/2b4b294f0a1aae991ba5253a36ca507c/1~20150523-212525" is named like a file version
```
